Data.event_text: 13 January - The Pegasus Airlines Flight 8622, which was leaving Trabzon Airport for Ankara, landed on the ground 25 meters away from the sea due to technical problems. 162 passengers and 6 crew survived without any injury.

links.text: -"Trabzon Havalimanı'nda son durum! Pegasus'tan ilk açıklama". Habertürk. 13 January 2018. Archived from the original on 15 January 2018. Retrieved 14 January 2018.-
-"Trabzon Havalimanı'nda son durum! Pegasus'tan ilk açıklama". Habertürk. 13 January 2018. Archived from the original on 15 January 2018. Retrieved 14 January 2018.-

Data.event_text: 17 January - CASA CN 235 military training aircraft crashed in Isparta. 3 soldiers were killed.

links.text: -"Isparta'da askeri eğitim uçağı düştü: 3 şehit". Milliyet. 17 January 2018. Archived from the original on 26 January 2018. Retrieved 25 January 2018.-
-"Isparta'da askeri eğitim uçağı düştü: 3 şehit". Milliyet. 17 January 2018. Archived from the original on 26 January 2018. Retrieved 25 January 2018.-

Data.event_text: 20 January - Operation Olive Branch started.

links.text: -"Turkish military operation in Syria's Afrin has begun: Erdogan". Reuters. 21 January 2018. Archived from the original on 28 January 2018. Retrieved 25 January 2018.-
-"Turkish military operation in Syria's Afrin has begun: Erdogan". Reuters. 21 January 2018. Archived from the original on 28 January 2018. Retrieved 25 January 2018.-
-"Turkey's Operation Olive Branch 'aims to bring 10,000 km2 of Afrin under control' - Turkey News". Hürriyet Daily News. Retrieved 2019-03-05.-

Data.event_text: 24 January - A rocket fired from Syria fell into the Çalık Mosque in Kilis city center and damaged a house 100 meters away. 2 people were killed.

links.text: -"Turkish border town hit by rockets, 13 wounded: governor". Reuters. 24 January 2018. Archived from the original on 28 January 2018. Retrieved 25 January 2018.-
-"Turkish border town hit by rockets, 13 wounded: governor". Reuters. 24 January 2018. Archived from the original on 28 January 2018. Retrieved 25 January 2018.-
-"2 killed in Turkey's border city by rockets from Syria". Xinhuanet.com. 25 January 2018. Archived from the original on 28 January 2018. Retrieved 27 January 2018.-
-"2 killed in Turkey's border city by rockets from Syria". Xinhuanet.com. 25 January 2018. Archived from the original on 28 January 2018. Retrieved 27 January 2018.-

Data.event_text: 28 January - Alican Kaynar won the bronze medal at the 2018 Sailing World Cup.

links.text: -"2018 Dünya Kupası'nda Bronz Madalya Gururu". Fenerbahce.org. 28 January 2018. Retrieved 26 February 2018.-

Data.event_text: 3 February - Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu, who received 86.7% of the signatures in the 36th Republican People's Party Ordinary Convention, was elected as the chairman for the 5th time.

links.text: -"CHP Kurultayı'nın galibi Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu oldu". Bloomberg HT. 3 February 2018. Archived from the original on 4 February 2018. Retrieved 1 March 2018.-
-"CHP Kurultayı'nın galibi Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu oldu". Bloomberg HT. 3 February 2018. Archived from the original on 4 February 2018. Retrieved 1 March 2018.-

Data.event_text: 18 February - In the 2018 Turkish Basketball Cup, Anadolu Efes S.K. defeats Tofaş S.K., winning their 11th title.

links.text: -"Kupada şampiyon Anadolu Efes!". Milliyet. 18 February 2018. Archived from the original on 27 February 2018. Retrieved 26 February 2018.-
-"Kupada şampiyon Anadolu Efes!". Milliyet. 18 February 2018. Archived from the original on 27 February 2018. Retrieved 26 February 2018.-

Data.event_text: 16 February - The training plane that took off from the İzmir Çiğli 2nd Main Jet Base Command fell down. 2 pilots died.

links.text: -"İzmir'de askeri uçak düştü, 2 şehit". Bloomberg HT. 16 February 2018. Archived from the original on 16 February 2018. Retrieved 1 March 2018.-
-"İzmir'de askeri uçak düştü, 2 şehit". Bloomberg HT. 16 February 2018. Archived from the original on 16 February 2018. Retrieved 1 March 2018.-

Data.event_text: 20 February - President Erdoğan said that Turkey should again consider criminalizing adultery and that Turkey made a mistake by not criminalizing adultery to join EU in 2004.

links.text: -"Turkey should again consider criminalizing adultery, Erdogan says". Reuters. 20 February 2018.-
-"Turkey made a mistake by not criminalizing adultery to join EU: Erdoğan - Turkey News".-

Data.event_text: 11 March - A Bombardier Challenger 604 private jet owned by Turkish group Başaran Holding crashed in the Zagros Mountains near Shahr-e Kord, Iran, while returning to Turkey from the United Arab Emirates. All three crew members and eight passengers on board were killed.

links.text: -"Crash of a Canadair CL-600-2B16 Challenger 604 near Shahr-e-Kord: 11 killed". Bureau of Aircraft Accidents Archives. 11 March 2018. Archived from the original on 13 March 2018. Retrieved 12 March 2018.-

-"Crash of a Canadair CL-600-2B16 Challenger 604 near Shahr-e-Kord: 11 killed". Bureau of Aircraft Accidents Archives. 11 March 2018. Archived from the original on 13 March 2018. Retrieved 12 March 2018.-
-"Başaran Holding'e ait özel uçak düştü: 11 kişiden kurtulan olmadı". BBC Türkçe. 11 March 2018. Retrieved 13 March 2018.-

Data.event_text: 13 March - The proposal regarding the creation of the election alliance of the political parties was passed by the Grand National Assembly of Turkey and made into law.

links.text: -"Seçim ittifakı teklifi Meclis'te kabul edildi". Bloomberg HT. 13 March 2018. Archived from the original on 18 March 2018. Retrieved 17 March 2018.-
-"Seçim ittifakı teklifi Meclis'te kabul edildi". Bloomberg HT. 13 March 2018. Archived from the original on 18 March 2018. Retrieved 17 March 2018.-

Data.event_text: 18 March - Afrin falls under the control of the Turkish Armed Forces and the Syrian National Army.

links.text: -"Turkey claims Afrin city centre is under 'total' control". The Guardian. 18 March 2018. Archived from the original on 4 April 2018. Retrieved 3 April 2018.-
-"Turkey claims Afrin city centre is under 'total' control". The Guardian. 18 March 2018. Archived from the original on 4 April 2018. Retrieved 3 April 2018.-

Data.event_text: 18 March - In the 12th Ordinary Grand Congress held by the Nationalist Movement Party, Devlet Bahçeli, who was the only candidate, was re-elected as the chairman.

links.text: -"Bahçeli, MHP Genel Başkanlığına yeniden seçildi". Anadolu Agency. 18 March 2018. Archived from the original on 4 April 2018. Retrieved 3 April 2018.-
-"Bahçeli, MHP Genel Başkanlığına yeniden seçildi". Anadolu Agency. 18 March 2018. Archived from the original on 4 April 2018. Retrieved 3 April 2018.-

Data.event_text: 22 March - The F-16 aircraft that made a training flight crashed near Nevşehir. 1 soldier died.

links.text: -"Nevşehir'de F-16 düştü: Bir asker hayatını kaybetti". BBC Türkçe. 22 March 2018. Archived from the original on 8 April 2018. Retrieved 3 April 2018.-
-"Nevşehir'de F-16 düştü: Bir asker hayatını kaybetti". BBC Türkçe. 22 March 2018. Archived from the original on 8 April 2018. Retrieved 3 April 2018.-

Data.event_text: 26 March - The EUTurkey Summit was held in Varna, Bulgaria.

links.text: -"Turkey-EU Summit to be held in Bulgaria on Monday". Anadolu Agency. 26 March 2018.-

Data.event_text: 1 April - Meral Akşener, who was the only candidate in the 1st Extraordinary Convention held by the Good Party, was re-elected as the chairman.

links.text: -"Meral Akşener yeniden Genel Başkan seçildi". Haberturk.com. 1 April 2018. Archived from the original on 5 April 2018. Retrieved 4 April 2018.-
-"Meral Akşener yeniden Genel Başkan seçildi". Haberturk.com. 1 April 2018. Archived from the original on 5 April 2018. Retrieved 4 April 2018.-

Data.event_text: 3 April - The UBAKUSAT nanosatellite was launched into space on board a Falcon 9 rocket.

links.text: -"Türk uydusu Falcon 9 roketiyle uzaya bırakıldı". Bloomberg HT. 3 April 2018. Archived from the original on 5 April 2018. Retrieved 4 April 2018.-
-"Türk uydusu Falcon 9 roketiyle uzaya bırakıldı". Bloomberg HT. 3 April 2018. Archived from the original on 5 April 2018. Retrieved 4 April 2018.-

Data.event_text: 3 April - The construction for the Akkuyu Nuclear Power Plant started.

links.text: -"Akkuyu Nükleer Güç Santrali'nin temeli atıldı". Bloomberg HT. 3 April 2018. Archived from the original on 5 April 2018. Retrieved 4 April 2018.-
-"Akkuyu Nükleer Güç Santrali'nin temeli atıldı". Bloomberg HT. 3 April 2018. Archived from the original on 5 April 2018. Retrieved 4 April 2018.-

Data.event_text: 13 April - Darüşşafaka defeats Lokomotiv Kuban in the finale of 201718 EuroCup Basketball, winning its first title.

links.text: -"Darüşşafaka EuroCup şampiyonu oldu". CNN Türk. 13 April 2018. Archived from the original on 29 April 2018. Retrieved 29 April 2018.-
-"Darüşşafaka EuroCup şampiyonu oldu". CNN Türk. 13 April 2018. Archived from the original on 29 April 2018. Retrieved 29 April 2018.-

Data.event_text: 18 April - Galatasaray defeats Reyer Venezia in the finale of 201718 EuroCup Women, winning its second title.

links.text: -"Galatasaray EuroCup şampiyonu oldu". Posta. 18 April 2018. Archived from the original on 12 May 2018. Retrieved 29 April 2018.-
-"Galatasaray EuroCup şampiyonu oldu". Posta. 18 April 2018. Archived from the original on 12 May 2018. Retrieved 29 April 2018.-

Data.event_text: 20 April - Proposal concerning a snap election on 24 June was passed and enacted by the Grand National Assembly.

links.text: -"Erken seçim önergesi Meclis'ten geçti". Bloomberg HT. 20 April 2018. Archived from the original on 10 May 2018. Retrieved 9 May 2018.-
-"Erken seçim önergesi Meclis'ten geçti". Bloomberg HT. 20 April 2018. Archived from the original on 10 May 2018. Retrieved 9 May 2018.-

Data.event_text: 6 May - VakıfBank S.K. defeats CSM Volei Alba Blaj in the final of 201718 CEV Women's Champions League, winning its fourth title.

links.text: -"CSM Volei Alba BLAJ - VakıfBank: 0-3". Haberturk.com. 6 May 2018. Archived from the original on 10 May 2018. Retrieved 9 May 2018.-
-"CSM Volei Alba BLAJ - VakıfBank: 0-3". Haberturk.com. 6 May 2018. Archived from the original on 10 May 2018. Retrieved 9 May 2018.-

Data.event_text: 10 May - Akhisar Belediyespor competed in the finale of the 201718 Turkish Cup and by defeating Fenerbahçe S.K. won its first title.

links.text: -"Teleset Mobilya Akhisarspor Fenerbahçe: 3-2 (Maç sonucu)". Sözcü (in Turkish). 10 May 2018. Retrieved 11 May 2018.-

Data.event_text: 13 May - President Erdoğan announced a "mega-scheme" towards infrastructure, including the construction of a large 400 metre wide canal which would cause disruption to farming communities. In response, critics questioned the need for the canal and warned it will destroy an 8,500-year-old archaeological site near Istanbul. They also voiced concern for predicted widespread environmental damage.

links.text: -Kucukgocmen, Ali (13 May 2018). "Erdogan's 'crazy' canal alarms villagers and environmentalists". Reuters.-

Data.event_text: 21 May - In the finale of 201718 season of the Women's Basketball Super League, Fenerbahçe Women's Basketball defeats Yakın Doğu Üniversitesi, winning its 13th title.

links.text: -"Kadınlar Basketbol Ligi şampiyonu Fenerbahçe". CNN Türk. 22 May 2018. Archived from the original on 14 June 2018. Retrieved 4 June 2018.-
-"Kadınlar Basketbol Ligi şampiyonu Fenerbahçe". CNN Türk. 22 May 2018. Archived from the original on 14 June 2018. Retrieved 4 June 2018.-

Data.event_text: 22 May - DenizBank, acquired by Sberbank of Russia in 2012, was sold to Emirates NBD in Dubai for $3.2 billion.

links.text: -"Denizbank 3,2 milyar dolara satıldı". Posta. 22 May 2018. Archived from the original on 22 May 2018. Retrieved 4 June 2018.-
-"Denizbank 3,2 milyar dolara satıldı". Posta. 22 May 2018. Archived from the original on 22 May 2018. Retrieved 4 June 2018.-

Data.event_text: 10 June - President Erdoğan warned that if the Austrian government were to expel Muslims, it could lead to war. He said “These measures taken by the Austrian prime minister are, I fear, leading the world towards a war between the cross and the crescent. They say they're going to kick our religious men out of Austria. Do you think we will not react if you do such a thing? That means we're going to have to do something".[citation needed]
12 June - TANAP, which connects the giant Shah Deniz gas field in Azerbaijan to Europe, was inaugurated by having its first gas flow.

links.text: -"TANAP'ın açılışı gerçekleşti". Bloomberg HT. 12 June 2018. Archived from the original on 11 July 2018. Retrieved 11 July 2018.-
-"TANAP'ın açılışı gerçekleşti". Bloomberg HT. 12 June 2018. Archived from the original on 11 July 2018. Retrieved 11 July 2018.-

Data.event_text: 13 June - Ovit Tunnel was opened.

links.text: -"Türkiye'nin en uzunu Ovit Tüneli açıldı". Hürriyet. 13 June 2018. Archived from the original on 11 July 2018. Retrieved 11 July 2018.-
-"Türkiye'nin en uzunu Ovit Tüneli açıldı". Hürriyet. 13 June 2018. Archived from the original on 11 July 2018. Retrieved 11 July 2018.-

Data.event_text: 13 June - In the 201718 Basketbol Süper Ligi, Fenerbahçe Basketball defeats Tofaş S.K., winning its 9th title and 3rd consecutive victory.

links.text: -"Fenerbahçe Doğuş, kulüp tarihinde ilki başardı!". Haberturk.com. 13 June 2018. Archived from the original on 11 July 2018. Retrieved 11 July 2018.-
-"Fenerbahçe Doğuş, kulüp tarihinde ilki başardı!". Haberturk.com. 13 June 2018. Archived from the original on 11 July 2018. Retrieved 11 July 2018.-

Data.event_text: 24 June - The presidential and general elections took place.
1 July - Ahmet Çelik won the 92nd Gazi Race with his horse named Hep Beraber. This was the 4th victory for Ahmet Çelik in a row.

links.text: -"2018 yılının Şampiyon ismi "Hep Beraber"". Jockey Club of Turkey. 1 July 2018. Archived from the original on 11 July 2018. Retrieved 11 July 2018.-
-"2018 yılının Şampiyon ismi "Hep Beraber"". Jockey Club of Turkey. 1 July 2018. Archived from the original on 11 July 2018. Retrieved 11 July 2018.-

Data.event_text: 7 July - The 27th Parliament of Turkey started by the MPs taking their oath.

links.text: -"TBMM'de 27. Dönem başladı". Bloomberg HT. 7 July 2018. Archived from the original on 7 August 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-
-"TBMM'de 27. Dönem başladı". Bloomberg HT. 7 July 2018. Archived from the original on 7 August 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-

Data.event_text: 8 July - The Çorlu train derailment occurred in northwestern Turkey when a train derailed, killing 24 passengers and injuring 318, including 42 severely.

links.text: -"Çorlu'daki tren kazasında ölü sayısı 25 oldu". Haberturk.com. 28 July 2018. Archived from the original on 29 July 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-
-"Çorlu'daki tren kazasında ölü sayısı 25 oldu". Haberturk.com. 28 July 2018. Archived from the original on 29 July 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-

Data.event_text: 9 July - After winning an absolute majority in the 2018 Turkish presidential election, Recep Tayyip Erdoğan took his oath during a ceremony attended by leaders of 22 countries and the presidential system in Turkey started.

links.text: -"İşte törene katılan ülke liderleri". hürriyet. 9 July 2018. Retrieved 9 July 2018.-
-"Cumhurbaşkanı Erdoğan yemin etti... Yeni yönetim sistemine geçildi". Hürriyet. 9 July 2018. Retrieved 9 July 2018.-
-"Yeni kabine: Hulusi Akar Savunma Bakanı, Berat Albayrak Hazine ve Maliye Bakanı oldu". BBC Türkçe. 10 July 2018. Archived from the original on 7 August 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-
-"Yeni kabine: Hulusi Akar Savunma Bakanı, Berat Albayrak Hazine ve Maliye Bakanı oldu". BBC Türkçe. 10 July 2018. Archived from the original on 7 August 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-

Data.event_text: 10 July - General Yaşar Güler was appointed as the Chief of General Staff of the Republic of Turkey.

links.text: -"Genelkurmay Başkanlığı'na Orgeneral Yaşar Güler atandı". Bloomberg HT. 10 July 2018. Archived from the original on 7 August 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-
-"Genelkurmay Başkanlığı'na Orgeneral Yaşar Güler atandı". Bloomberg HT. 10 July 2018. Archived from the original on 7 August 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-

Data.event_text: 12 July - In the third round of the elections held by the Grand National Assembly, Binali Yıldırım was elected as the 28th Speaker of the Grand National Assembly.

links.text: -"Binali Yıldırım 335 oyla Meclis Başkanı seçildi". BBC Türkçe. 12 July 2018. Archived from the original on 7 August 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-
-"Binali Yıldırım 335 oyla Meclis Başkanı seçildi". BBC Türkçe. 12 July 2018. Archived from the original on 7 August 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-

Data.event_text: 19 July - The state of emergency, announced on 20 , officially ended.

links.text: -"Türkiye'de OHAL sona erdi". Hürriyet. 19 July 2018. Archived from the original on 9 August 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-
-"Türkiye'de OHAL sona erdi". Hürriyet. 19 July 2018. Archived from the original on 9 August 2018. Retrieved 7 August 2018.-

Data.event_text: 5 August - Akhisar Belediyespor wins the finale of 2018 Turkish Super Cup by defeating Galatasaray S.K. 54 on penalties.

links.text: -"Süper Kupa Akhisarspor'un". Fanatik (in Turkish). fanatik.com.tr. 5 August 2018. Retrieved 17 August 2018.-

Data.event_text: 14 October - Road accident left 15 migrants dead in Gaziemir, İzmir.

links.text: -"Twenty-two killed as truck carrying migrants crashes in Turkey". Reuters. 2018-10-14. Retrieved 2019-01-07.-

Data.event_text: 19 October - STAR Refinery was commissioned in Aliağa, İzmir.

links.text: -"Star Rafinerisi açıldı". Bloomberg HT. 19 October 2018. Archived from the original on 22 October 2018. Retrieved 22 October 2018.-
-"Star Rafinerisi açıldı". Bloomberg HT. 19 October 2018. Archived from the original on 22 October 2018. Retrieved 22 October 2018.-
-"SOCAR's STAR refinery in Turkey's İzmir to be inaugurated today". DailySabah. 19 October 2018. Retrieved 2019-03-05.-

Data.event_text: 27 October - Russian President Vladimir Putin, German Chancellor Angela Merkel, French President Emmanuel Macron and President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan came together at the Vahdettin Pavilion in Istanbul as part of a summit on the Syrian civil war.
11 November - In the 40th Istanbul Marathon, Kenyan Felix Kimutai won the men's title, while Kenyan Ruth Chepngetich won the women's.

links.text: -"Kadınlarda Ruth Chepngetich kazandı". TRT Spor. 11 November 2018. Archived from the original on 1 December 2018. Retrieved 30 November 2018.-
-"Kadınlarda Ruth Chepngetich kazandı". TRT Spor. 11 November 2018. Archived from the original on 1 December 2018. Retrieved 30 November 2018.-

Data.event_text: 18 November - Can Öncü became the youngest Grand Prix motorcycle racing winner when he won the 2018 Valencian Community motorcycle Grand Prix aged 15 years, 115 days, and the first Turkish winner of a GP motorcycle road race.

links.text: -"Moto3 Valencia race results 2018: Can Oncu, youngest winner, debut, Scott Redding, Red Bull". Foxsports.com.au. 18 November 2018. Archived from the original on 1 December 2018. Retrieved 30 November 2018.-

-"Moto3 Valencia race results 2018: Can Oncu, youngest winner, debut, Scott Redding, Red Bull". Foxsports.com.au. 18 November 2018. Archived from the original on 1 December 2018. Retrieved 30 November 2018.-

Data.event_text: 23 November - Necmettin Erbakan's son Fatih Erbakan established a party under the name of the Yeniden Refah Party.

links.text: -"Fatih Erbakan açıkladı! 'Yeniden Refah Partisi'ni kurduk…". Hürriyet. 23 November 2018. Archived from the original on 24 November 2018. Retrieved 30 November 2018.-
-"Fatih Erbakan açıkladı! 'Yeniden Refah Partisi'ni kurduk…". Hürriyet. 23 November 2018. Archived from the original on 24 November 2018. Retrieved 30 November 2018.-

Data.event_text: 26 November - A UH-1 type military helicopter crashed in Sancaktepe, Istanbul. 4 soldiers died.

links.text: -"Sancaktepe'de helikopterin düşme anı kamerada". CNN Türk. 26 November 2018. Archived from the original on 1 December 2018. Retrieved 30 November 2018.-
-"Sancaktepe'de helikopterin düşme anı kamerada". CNN Türk. 26 November 2018. Archived from the original on 1 December 2018. Retrieved 30 November 2018.-

Data.event_text: 13 December - Marşandiz train collision killed 9.
